summary: REQ-1 is implemented by updating the initial headline to ‚ÄúWill you be my Valentine, Suzanne The Nazareth?‚Äù. The YES flow is updated to show a final-stage image at /assets/aman_suz_pic.jpeg, but the actual static asset file is not added in this diff, so the requirement to include and reliably serve the provided image is not fully met.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add the uploaded image file aman_suz_pic.jpeg to the frontend static assets and reference it from the final stage UI.
missing_requirements.reason: The code references /assets/aman_suz_pic.jpeg, but the diff shows no added files, so the image itself is not included in the repository as a static asset in this change set.

missing_requirements.requirement: After the user clicks YES, show the provided uploaded image (aman_suz_pic.jpeg) as the final photo in the YES flow without requiring the user to upload a photo (served as a static asset and reliable on refresh).
missing_requirements.reason: The YES->celebrating->final transition is implemented and the final stage references /assets/aman_suz_pic.jpeg, but because the image file is not added anywhere in this diff, the acceptance criterion that it renders reliably on refresh as a static asset is not satisfied by the changes shown.

hallucinated_features.description: Global styling/theme overhaul including OKLCH palette variables, a full-screen fixed container, and disabling body scrolling (overflow: hidden).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on updating the displayed name and swapping the final YES photo to a provided static asset; it does not request broad theme/token changes or global scroll-locking behavior beyond what is necessary for the photo display.
evidence: frontend/src/index.css (:root OKLCH palette variables and extensive theme tokens)

hallucinated_features.description: Added/changed new final-stage copy text (‚ÄúI knew you'd say yes üíï‚Äù and ‚ÄúMade with love, just for you.‚Äù).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only specifies changing the initial headline name text and displaying the provided photo after YES; it does not request altering other visible UI strings in the final stage.
